name: 239 Eagle Drive Duplex
property_type: Single Family w/ MIL Suite (Duplex Potential)

financial_details.notes: Property purchased for $750K, cost basis $780K with improvements. Current market value $950K. Mortgage data from Wells Fargo as of Aug 2025.

features: Master bedroom ensuite on main level

property_tax.notes: Based on Wells Fargo escrow: $2,136.51 x 2 payments/year

insurance.notes: USAA homeowners insurance from Wells Fargo escrow

mortgage.notes: Wells Fargo mortgage payment - P&I + escrow

utilities.notes: Oil heat system - owner pays heating in winter

maintenance_reserve.notes: Updated with 2024-2025 expense framework: 14.7% for OLD property (1973) duplex with mountain weather conditions

vacancy_allowance.notes: Updated with expense framework: 6.3% for LTR suburban location (college town adjusted)

property_management.notes: Expense framework confirms 10% for full-service LTR management

other_expenses.notes: Updated with expense framework: 4.4% for LTR other expenses (insurance, utilities, CapEx, admin, supplies)

market_assumptions.notes: Property: 4.2% appreciation. Rent: 5.0% growth (college town demand, limited supply, inflation + premium growth). Rent growth typically exceeds property appreciation.

historical_context.boone_premiums: College town demand (ASU), mountain location, limited developable land
historical_context.market_factors: Higher than statewide due to university, golf course location, rental demand

market_assumptions.stock_market_notes: More conservative long-term stock return assumption, down from 10%

sale_assumptions.notes: 6% realtor + 1% costs to sell + 0.5% closing + 0.5% concession + 0.5% other = 8.5% total

both_units.description: Both Unit A and Unit B rented to long-term tenants

unit_a_only.description: Only Unit A (main house) rented, Unit B vacant

unit_b_only.description: Only Unit B (MIL suite) rented, live in Unit A

premium_rents.description: Higher rents due to golf course location and amenities

jt_scenario.description: JT family scenario: Unit B only for 2 years ($2,200), then mom moves to Unit A ($1,500) + Unit B continues ($2,300)

phase_2.notes: Mom in Unit A ($1,500 family rate) + regular renter in Unit B ($2,300 market rate)

taylor_scenario.description: Taylor scenario: Unit A upstairs ($2,500) + Unit B downstairs ($2,200) - optimized rental rates
taylor_scenario.notes: Higher Unit A rent reflects upstairs premium and larger space (3BR vs 1BR)

notes: Property has excellent rental potential due to separate living spaces
Boone market driven by ASU student/faculty demand
Golf course location provides premium appeal
Consider short-term rental (Airbnb) potential for higher returns
Oil heat system may require budget for heating costs in winter months
